channel.title: Morning Mail
channel.description: Stay updated on the latest news and events happening in the RPI community.

item.title: Engineering Ambassadors WeRGold Accepting Donations Toward STEM Outreach Trip
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 17, 2023 - Sat , July 1, 2023 (all day) - The Engineering Ambassadors are seeking donations to help support their overnight trip to New York City to present engineering topics such as Drag Force, Water Filtration, and Biosensors to three city high schools. Historically, more than 1,000 high school students have experienced STEM presentations and activities on each trip that the Ambassadors have made to the Bronx!
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Electronic Arts Exhibition Open June 9-18
item.description: Date: Friday, June 9, 2023 11:00 AM - Sun , June 18, 2023 5:00 PM - The RPI Electronic Arts exhibition showcases a host of immersive and interactive audio-visual installations, multichannel music compositions, and performances featuring live coding, and a special live event featuring Pauline Oliveros’ Expanded Instrument System (EIS).
item.author: Community

item.title: RPI Community Now Has Free Access to New York Times Audio
item.description: The Rensselaer Libraries are pleased to announce that the New York Times Academic Site License News subscription — which is provided by the Libraries — now includes the recently-launched New York Times Audio. The new app, which is currently only available for iOS devices, includes audio journalism and storytelling on everything from world events to the daily headlines to reporters’ reads of top stories.
item.author: Community

item.title: Weekend Student Event to Feature Night Hike, Outdoor Programs
item.description: Date: Saturday, June 3, 2023 8:00 PM - Sun , June 4, 2023 12:00 AM - Rensselaer’s Office of the Campus Experience invites interested students to follow @rpicampusrecreation or contact James Bradbury for more information on how to sign up for this event. Note that registration is required, as only eleven slots are available. Participants should plan to meet at the Union Horseshoe.
item.author: Students

item.title: Registration Currently Open for NSF Graduate Research Fellowship Program Bootcamp
item.description: Date: Wednesday, May 17, 2023 (all day) - Rising seniors, as well as first- and second-year graduate students, are encouraged to register by June 1 for this proven five-week virtual program to develop strong applications to the NSF GRFP, which provides three years of tuition and salary to graduate students in 30 disciplines. U.S. citizenship or permanent residency required; participants may choose either a June or August session. Please contact Betty Madigan if you have any questions.
item.author: Students

item.title: Applications Now Open for Forge Summer Student Volunteers
item.description: Date: Tuesday, May 30, 2023 (all day) - The Forge is looking for summer student volunteers to assist with student project support including 3D printing, laser cutting, and general sharing of design and manufacturing knowledge. If interested in volunteering, please contact Maddie Dwyer or Sam Chiappone for more information.
item.author: Students

item.title: MBA for Professionals Information Session Scheduled for June 1
item.description: Date: Thursday, June 1, 2023 7:00 PM - 7:30 PM - Join Rensselaer Dean Aric Krause, Ph.D., for a review of this innovative project-based, online MBA for professionals program. Participants will learn to lead from every aspect of an organization with real-world MBA experience, prepare to lead the most dynamic and innovative organizations, and engage, involve, motivate, and lead others to reach their fullest potential. Please register to attend.
item.author: Faculty and Staff

item.title: AEFIS Course Evaluation Results Training to be Offered to Instructors, TAs
item.description:
Spring 2023 end-of-term course evaluations will be available to instructors on May 26, 2023. The Office of Undergraduate Education will be offering live webinar training sessions on May 31 and June 6 with tips on how instructors can run their course evaluation results.

For information about sharing your news or events, or to change your subscription settings, visit morningmail.rpi.edu.
item.author: Faculty and Staff
